body.p:
Louisville 7 Oct 1863.
Hon Thos E. Bramlett
Govenor of Ky.
Dear Sir;

I received yours of 10th Septr last. I immediately ask for, and have since obtained copies of the Indictments as well as the judgments upon which executives issued alluded to in years. It seems one indictment was for attempting to entice away the negro girl Savilla, and the other was for stealing her appane jewlry, &c, all belonging to the said girl, tho the indictment it was the property of John Danson, which is not true as it was the property of the negro girl.
You will find a letter to this effect of C. J. Vandersept, who was living there at the time, and whose testimony would have exonerated Garis.
I am in hopes you will send a full remission of the Judgments. The parties are poor and very needy, and if compelled to pay one half of it would bring a perfect ruin upon them.
